entry.title: Combined summary - External IP Address
entry.summary: The message author created a website called ip.bitcheck.us which captures IP, user agent, and time for analysis. The site sends information when clients visit it and contains errors that are trapped to display the IP address in headers. In an email conversation, Sam suggested looking for X-Client-Update to check if the check-in was logged. He also mentioned that errors are trapped, and the IP address is always displayed in the headers. However, Wladimir thanked Sam for his effort but stated the current idea is to phase out centralized external services in favor of peer-based address detection. Wladimir provides a link to a Github page for Bitcoin where this information can be found.
